alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 7:27PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN AND GUSTY WINDS POSSIBLE LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND... A tropical circulation, known as Invest 94W, continues to be monitored by the Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC) and your National Weather Service Forecast Office in Guam. Based on visible satellite imagery and radar data, the center of 94W is located near 12.7N 143.9E, which is 65 miles southwest of Merizo. It still looks like 94W will remain a poorly-organized circulation as it gets absorbed into Tropical Depression Lan (07W), which is located well to the north-northeast of the CNMI. However, the numerical models also show a southwesterly monsoonal flow will develop Wednesday evening into Thursday, with Guam being on the northwestern edge of this stronger wind flow/moisture surge. Then, as 94W gets absorbed into Lan, this monsoonal flow will lift to the northwest to encompass all of the CNMI and Guam for the Friday morning through Sunday time frame. Although it won`t be raining all the time, locally heavy showers and thunderstorms will occur from time to time. As these stronger showers and/or thunderstorms develop, they may produce brief gusty winds to 40 mph. In addition to lightning, seas and surf will increase. A high rip risk may briefly develop. Mariners will see winds and seas increasing, reduced visibilities, and a lightning threat developing. Location: Guam and the CNMI When: Wednesday evening through Sunday for Guam Friday morning through Sunday for the CNMI Impacts: Rainfall totals of 4 to 8 inches, with locally higher amounts possible. Wind gusts to 40 mph over land, and gusts of 30 to 35 knots over coastal waters. Recommendations: Continue to monitor the forecasts. Tie down any canopies and remove any loose objects in case stronger wind gusts occur. You can also monitor the updates at www.weather.gov/gum/ We can also be found on Facebook and Twitter.
